page.title: 12The Cathedral, St. Andrews
page.content: In the historic town of St. Andrews there are the ruins of an ancient cathedral. It sits beside the sea at the east end of town. Founded in 1160 and consecrated in 1318, it was abandoned during the Reformation. Thereafter the ruins were used as a convenient source of stone for house building in the town.The roof and bits of the walls are long gone.The visitor is free to look around without admission charge. The grounds were at one time the main graveyard of the town and contain a large collection of monuments and gravestones. In the Cathedral grounds is St. Rule's Tower.The visitor has to pay to climb to the top.
